title: Data Visualization
text:
Option 1: tidytuesdayR package
install.packages(“tidytuesdayR”)
tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2024, week = 20)
coffee_survey <- tuesdata$coffee_survey

title: Coffee Survey
text:
library(tidytuesdayR)
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2024, week = 20)

---- Compiling #TidyTuesday Information for 2024-05-14 ----
--- There is 1 file available ---


── Downloading files ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

  1 of 1: "coffee_survey.csv"

coffee_survey <- tuesdata$coffee_survey

ggplot(coffee_survey, aes(x = favorite, fill = age)) +
  geom_bar() +
  labs(
    x = "Population density",
    y = "Count",
    title = "Population density of midwesten counties",
    subtitle = "Binwidth = 100"
  )

title: Cheese
text:
library(tidytuesdayR)
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(dplyr)

tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2024, week = 23)

---- Compiling #TidyTuesday Information for 2024-06-04 ----
--- There is 1 file available ---


── Downloading files ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

  1 of 1: "cheeses.csv"

cheeses <- tuesdata$cheeses

cleaned_cheeses <- cheeses %>%
  filter(!is.na(milk) & !is.na(color) & !is.na(count))

Warning: There was 1 warning in `filter()`.
ℹ In argument: `!is.na(milk) & !is.na(color) & !is.na(count)`.
Caused by warning in `is.na()`:
! is.na() applied to non-(list or vector) of type 'closure'

ggplot(cleaned_cheeses, aes(x = milk, y = color)) +
  geom_tile() +
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "pink", high = "lightgreen") +  # Customize colors
  labs(
    x = "Population density",
    y = "Count",
    title = "Population density of midwesten counties",
    subtitle = "Binwidth = 100"
  )
